headline: This crypto miner is capitalizing on AI data center energy demands
summary: On the back of the AI boom, Australia-based IREN (IREN) is expanding past its bitcoin mining (BTC-USD) operations and into building out large-scale grid facilities that will aid in powering data centers using renewable energy. Artificial intelligence stocks are all the talk this week after Nvidia (NVDA) announced multibillion-dollar investments and partnerships with OpenAI, Intel (INTC), and Alibaba (BABA). IREN Co-Founder and Co-CEO Daniel Roberts joins Julie Hyman in-studio to talk about its integration of Nvidia GPUs into its crypto mining facilities and AI data centers. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Are Nvidia, Oracle mega-deals signs of an AI bubble forming?
summary: While US stocks (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC) are lifted in another AI-fueled rally tied to Nvidia's (NVDA) and Oracle's (ORCL) latest headlines, could a bubble be starting to form around markets? Crossmark Global Investments chief market strategist Victoria Fernandez and Yahoo Finance senior reporters Brooke DiPalma and Ines Ferré assess the market conditions that could be signaling a bubble. Also catch Asterozoa Capital's Joe Hegener illustrate whether investors are pouring "gasoline on the fire" as an AI-driven bubble could be forming around markets. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Is an AI bubble forming? We could be pouring gas 'on the fire.'
summary: While more tech giants invest heavily into artificial intelligence — Nvidia's (NVDA) multibillion-dollar investments in Intel (INTC) and OpenAI, Alibaba (BABA) raising its AI spending past $50 billion — is an AI bubble starting to form around markets (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC)? Asterozoa Capital CIO Joe Hegener sits down with Morning Brief host Julie Hyman to analyze whether a bubble could be forming around equity markets, driven by AI and the Federal Reserve cutting interest rates. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.
